intro: Teucrium scorodonia var. pseudoscorodonia, commonly known as the Armenian germander, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often slightly hairy on the upper surface. Its small, tubular flowers are typically blue or purple, arranged in terminal or lateral clusters. It is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
